intro: Lycioplesium puberulum, commonly known as the hairy nightshade, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its toxicity, it is often avoided in gardens and natural areas.
